skill.name: examples/code-reviewer
skill.description: AI-powered code review tool that analyzes code for bugs, style issues, and improvements
skill.summary: AI code reviewer that finds bugs, security issues, and style problems with fix suggestions
skill.author: Enact Examples

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based code analysis skill with no code execution capabilities. All 14 static findings are false positives: markdown code fences were misidentified as shell backtick execution, the word 'description' was flagged due to substring matching, and example bug code was misidentified as system reconnaissance. The skill only analyzes code text and returns structured JSON output.

content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and error-prone. This AI code reviewer automatically analyzes source code to identify bugs, security vulnerabilities, style issues, and performance problems with actionable fix suggestions.
actual_capabilities: Identifies logic errors like null pointer risks, off-by-one errors, and race conditions
Detects security issues including injection vulnerabilities and hardcoded secrets
Flags style problems such as naming conventions and code organization
Spots performance issues like inefficient algorithms and N+1 queries
Provides severity levels and specific line numbers for each issue
Suggests concrete fixes and improvements with code examples
limitations: Does not execute code, only performs static analysis on text
Cannot detect issues in dynamically generated or compiled code
May miss context-dependent bugs that require runtime understanding
Language detection is automatic and may not work for unusual codebases

use_cases.title: Quick Code Audits
use_cases.description: Run automated checks on pull requests or commits to catch issues before human review

use_cases.title: Learning and Improvement
use_cases.description: Junior developers learn best practices by seeing detailed explanations of code issues and fixes

use_cases.title: Security Scanning
use_cases.description: Focus on security aspects to identify potential vulnerabilities like injection flaws and secret exposure

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Review
prompt_templates.prompt:
Perform a full code review on this snippet. Cover bugs, style, performance, and security. For each issue found, provide:
- Severity (error, warning, or info)
- Line number
- Problem explanation
- Suggested fix

```
{code}
```

Language: {language}
Focus: all

output: ERROR - Line 2: Assignment operator (=) used instead of comparison (===) in find callback
ERROR - Line 3: Accessing .name on potentially undefined user
WARNING - Line 2: Using 'var' instead of 'const' or 'let'
Score: 35/100 - Critical bugs and outdated syntax detected
ERROR - Line 3: Off-by-one error: loop condition should be 'i < items.length'
WARNING - Line 3: Potential undefined access if items array has gaps
Score: 60/100 - Functional but has subtle bug

output_examples.input:
const query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = " + userId;
db.execute(query);
output: ERROR - Line 1: SQL injection vulnerability - userId concatenated directly into query
ERROR - Line 2: Executes unsafe SQL query
SUGGESTION - Use parameterized queries: db.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', [userId])

best_practices: Provide the programming language explicitly for more accurate analysis
Use the focus parameter to target specific issue types when you have particular concerns
Review high-severity issues first as they often indicate critical bugs or security vulnerabilities
Use the suggestions to learn and improve your coding practices over time
anti_patterns: Do not rely solely on automated review without understanding the underlying issues
Avoid using the code reviewer as a replacement for human architectural review
Do not ignore informational warnings as they often indicate technical debt
Avoid reviewing code in isolation without understanding the broader system context

faq.question: What programming languages does this code reviewer support?
faq.answer: The code reviewer works with any programming language by analyzing the text structure. However, it has deeper knowledge of common languages like JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, and Ruby.

faq.question: How accurate is the AI code review?
faq.answer: The AI catches most common bugs and style issues with high accuracy. Some edge cases or context-dependent issues may require human review for final validation.

faq.question: Can this replace human code review?
faq.answer: No. This tool is designed to augment human review by catching common issues faster. Human reviewers are still needed for architectural decisions and complex logic validation.

faq.question: Does the code reviewer execute any code?
faq.answer: No. The code reviewer only performs static analysis on the text you provide. It never executes the code being reviewed.

faq.question: How are severity levels determined?
faq.answer: Errors indicate bugs that will cause failures or security issues. Warnings point to code quality problems or potential future issues. Info suggestions are best practice recommendations.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. You can call this skill as part of your pipeline to get automated feedback on code changes. The structured JSON output is designed for programmatic processing.
